content: Can the value of Information Gain be negative? Is there a possibility for this to occur?

No, the value of Information Gain cannot be negative. Information Gain measures the reduction in entropy or uncertainty about a target variable after observing a feature or attribute. It is calculated as the difference between the entropy of the target variable before and after splitting based on a particular feature.

Since entropy is a measure of uncertainty and cannot be negative, the reduction in entropy (Information Gain) is also non-negative. In other words, observing additional information (splitting on a feature) can either reduce the uncertainty or leave it unchanged, but it cannot increase it, which would be required for Information Gain to be negative.
